action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Abyssal Manifestation. makes two attacks with Astral silver fragment attacks and cast one spell.

action.name: Abyssal fury {@recharge 4}
entries: The Abyssal Manifestation make six Astral silver fragment attack . Either before or after these attacks, it can move up to its speed as a bonus action without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Bracelet of astral fragments
entries: Using an action, Abyssal Manifestation can cast four fragments of astral silver and toss them immediately after casting them

action.name: Astral silver fragment
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Abyssal Jump.
entries: using the bonus action the Abyssal Manifestation can teleport to any direction within 30 feet, he needs to see the location before jumping.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The abyssal manifestation. has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the abyssal manifestation. is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the abyssal manifestation. instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Dark Run
entries: The abyssal manifestation. can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Elusive
entries: Abyssal Manifestation are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against him. No attack roll has advantage against Abyssal Manifestation while him aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the abyssal manifestation. deals an extra 30 ({@damage 10d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the abyssal manifestation. that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the abyssal manifestation. doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

reaction.name: One day, an arcane trickster
entries: If Abyssal Manifestation are the target of a spell, he can use the reaction to usurp the caster's spell. Forcing to make a check of your spellcasting ability ... if fail, the spell fails and is misused and you cannot cast it in the next 8 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Abyssal Manifestation's spellcasting ability is Inteligence (spell save {@dc 18}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
